title: Electric PE - DeltaU of 2Q -Q and third pt charge

content.question: Two point charges, one with positive charge <math alttext="positive 2 times uppercase Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math> and one with negative charge <math alttext="negative uppercase Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math>, are fixed in place a distance <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math> apart. The electric potential energy of the two-point charge system is <math alttext="U sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. If a third, positive, point charge is added to the system, where should the third point charge be located so that the electric potential energy of the three-point charge system is still <math alttext="U sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>? What evidence or reasoning supports the claim?

choices.label: Closer to the <math alttext="positive 2 times uppercase Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math> point charge. The third point charge should be closer to the original point charge with the larger-magnitude charge.

Closer to the <math alttext="positive 2 times uppercase Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math> point charge. The third point charge should be closer to the original point charge of the same sign.

Closer to the <math alttext="negative uppercase Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math> point charge. The third point charge should be closer to the original point charge with the smaller-magnitude charge.

Closer to the <math alttext="negative uppercase Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math> point charge. The third point charge should be closer to the original point charge of the opposite sign.

content.answer: Closer to the <math alttext="negative uppercase Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math> point charge. The third point charge should be closer to the original point charge with the smaller-magnitude charge.
